channel.title: Data Mechanics
channel.description: Python, Business Intelligence, and Machine Learning with Klaus Folz

item.title: Projects
item.dc:creator: exactly6445acab7a
item.content:encoded:
PyDAX

PyDAX is a python package designed to analyze DAX, it can extract comments, remove comments, and identify columns and measures referenced in DAX expressions.

PyDAX on GitHub

PyDAX on the Python Package Index (PyPI)

Measure Killer

Measure Killer is an external tool for Power BI and Microsoft Fabric developed by the Brunner BI Team, where I work as a lead developer. It can identify and remove unused measures and columns from Power BI models, analyze best practices and scan your Fabric tenant.

Download Measure Killer

WORLD DATA REPORT

The World Data Report is a Power BI project that offers a detailed overview of global data, covering weather, geographical, demographic, and socio-economic aspects. The data is sourced from a combination of APIs, web integrations, and local CSV files.

World Data Report on GitHub

Youtube downloader

An easy to use Python GUI based application. The YouTube Downloader allows you to download videos or audio from YouTube by simply pasting the URL.

YouTube Downloader on GitHub

Publications

An investigation of machine learning strategies for electric motor anomaly detection using vibration and audio signals

Published on Engineering Computations (ISSN: 0264-4401) on 10 December 2024.

An evaluation and comparison of the performance of two machine learning (ML) algorithms, i.e. support vector machines (SVMs) and random forests (RFs), when classifying seven states of operation of an electric motor using the Mel-frequency cepstral coefficients (MFCCs) as extracted representative features.

Project on GitHub

Article on Engineering Computations

About the author

Hi, I’m Klaus Jürgen Folz, a Microsoft-certified Power BI Data Analyst (PL-300) and a Mechanical Engineer. I specialize in developing, optimizing, and managing Power BI solutions, using my expertise in Python for data science and automation. I’m also the lead developer of Measure Killer, a Power BI external tool.

item.title: Welcome to Data Mechanics
item.dc:creator: exactly6445acab7a
item.content:encoded:
Welcome you to Data Mechanics! I created this website to share my knowledge and experiences in Python, Machine Learning and BI. Here, I’ll be posting tips, tricks, and, most importantly, showcasing my projects for colleges and enthusiasts to explore, discuss and complain that they don't work at all.

The name Data Mechanics was inspired by my background and passion for mechanical engineering and data science.

Thank you for visiting!

item.title: Front Page
item.dc:creator: exactly6445acab7a
item.content:encoded: Hey, World.
item.excerpt:encoded: Displays your site's homepage, whether it is set to display latest posts or a static page. The Front Page template takes precedence over all templates.

item.title: Blog Home
item.dc:creator: exactly6445acab7a
item.content:encoded: We’re a collaborative architecture office committed to sustainable, ethic, humanist values.
item.excerpt:encoded: Displays the latest posts as either the site homepage or as the "Posts page" as defined under reading settings. If it exists, the Front Page template overrides this template when posts are shown on the homepage.

item.title: Pages
item.dc:creator: exactly6445acab7a
item.content:encoded:
# Data Mechanics homepage
class DataMechanics:
    def __init__(self):
        ...
    def __str__(self):
        return """\
        Data Mechanics was created by Klaus Jürgen 
        Folz, a Power BI and Python developer based in 
        Austria. Data Mechanics focuses on Business 
        Intelligence, creating open-source solutions for 
        data analysis and BI. Our flagship project 
        includes PyDAX, a Python package designed as a 
        powerful DAX lexer for parsing and analyzing DAX 
        """

Services

Python

Power BI
item.excerpt:encoded: Displays a static page unless a custom template has been applied to that page or a dedicated template exists.
